quest.name: The Path Forward
journal: Lyse is not willing to let this opportunity pass you by.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Conrad confided in me that he was considering naming her as his successor, so it didn't come as a complete shock. I mean, I was still surprised, but I've never once doubted his judgment. None of us have. If he thought Lyse was the best choice, then she is.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: (When did Lyse become leader of the Resistance? That...that is... Hm. I suppose we have Hien to thank for this too.)

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I understand M'naago's concern. If they were to lose another leader so soon after losing Conrad, it would be devastating.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: (More than a keeper, she needs a friend now. Stay close to her.)

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: One can but wonder how the rank and file of the XIIth Legion will view their leadership upon hearing about the fate of Specula Imperatoris.

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Grim though it is, the conjurers have had no choice but to impose a rigid triage system when treating the wounded. Under the circumstances, we have to be realistic.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: Mark my words: when this is over, I will take the heads of every officer in Castrum Abania. I'll swing the bloody axe myself if I have to!

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I still can't believe it. Conrad, and so many others, dead. It's not right, what those bastards did... It's not right.

dialogue.name: VMAHTIA
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe the two fools we caught skulking about in imperial uniforms. It felt good handing them over to the Alliance...though it all feels pointless now.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: Conrad always treated us with kindness and respect. His death will not go unavenged.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: There's no time to lose, Forename! General Aldynn needs to know what we saw!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: I'm relieved the two of you made it back in one piece. I mean, I always am, but it's a little different now, isn't it?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You look like you've got something important to say...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well? Did you learn anything of value?

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: So long as the imperials hold Castrum Abania, we will not be able to march on Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: We have lost so many men already... If we suffer another defeat like that, this campaign is over.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: We will have our retribution. It is but a matter of time.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: You are returned. I only hope you bring good news.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We scaled the cliffs of Nyunkrepf's Hope and spied smoke rising from Castrum Abania's main cannon.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I think Marshal Tarupin's right─they didn't fire again because they couldn't. The cannon seems to have been disabled somehow.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then we must attack Castrum Abania at once!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Hm. It could still be a trick. But if it isn't, we may not get a better opportunity.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Bluntly, General, if it is a trick, it is an utterly baffling stratagem. Had the imperials wished to wipe us out, they could simply have kept firing.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Be that as it may, we need not risk everything to seize it. I say we dispatch a small contingent to infiltrate the castrum and secure control of the weapon.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: If the enemy is preoccupied with repairs, we may be able to take them unawares. If, on the other hand, it is indeed a trick, our token force will prove an elusive target─and we will at least know the cannon is operational.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Either way, it seems well worth the risk. But how are we to infiltrate the castrum?

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: ...In anticipation of a day such as this, men and women under my command have labored long to cultivate a network of informants throughout Gyr Abania─including Radiata.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Radiata is home to many who hold menial positions at Castrum Abania and other nearby installations. With the aid of our allies there, I believe we can secure a route into the fortress.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: The Resistance will handle this. You may have recruited these informants, but they'll be just as happy working with fellow Ala Mhigans. And at the end of the day, it's our land─our responsibility. Let us do right by Conrad.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I should be glad to accompany her, General─as would Alisaie and Forename, I am sure.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Well then. If you are all in agreement, I see no reason to refuse you.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We will make ready to march on Castrum Abania. Go, and may Rhalgr watch over and keep you.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Had Alphinaud not volunteered you, I would have asked. If anyone can see this mission through, it's you.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Thanks for standing by me, Forename. Together, we'll make Conrad proud!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...I suspect a handpicked contingent of the Ala Mhigan Brigade's finest would have been equally, if not more, qualified...but what do I know.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Perhaps you recall the night we first met outside the Sil'dihn ruins, under such unfortunate circumstances? I had just returned from a meeting with my Ala Mhigan agents. As I said before, we have been preparing for this day.

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: We have lost so many men already... If we suffer another defeat like that, this campaign is over.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: We will have our retribution. It is but a matter of time.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Hm! I knew the Alliance had spies in Gyr Abania, but in Radiata? Impressive...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: My apologies for speaking on your behalf. It would seem my sister's forthright manner is rubbing off on me... I confess, my decision to volunteer was not wholly motived by concern for Lyse, nor less Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Castrum Abania is the largest imperial facility in the Peaks, you see, and so the likelihood that Krile is being held captive there is quite high...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Dealing with that cannon remains our main objective, of course, but if there is even a chance that Krile might be rescued in the process, I would never forgive myself if I did not take it.
